summary_points: 1. Travelers incurred a $1.7 billion pre-tax catastrophe loss (net of reinsurance) from California wildfires in early January 2025.
2.  In 2024, Travelers' diluted net income per share increased by 68% to $21.47, primarily driven by higher underwriting margins and net investment income.
3.  Travelers acquired Corvus Insurance Holdings, Inc. for $427 million in January 2024, adding $478 million in assets and $51 million in liabilities.
1. GE HealthCare's net income attributable to common stockholders increased significantly by $604 million in 2024, reaching $1,993 million.
2.  Despite a 1% overall revenue increase in 2024,  Chinese sales decreased by 15% due to the delayed stimulus program and anti-corruption campaign.
3.  GE HealthCare anticipates $36 million in additional restructuring expenses over the next 12 months (ending February 2026).
1. Brown & Brown, Inc.'s revenue increased by 12.9% year-over-year in 2024, reaching $4,805 million, while net income increased by 14% to $993 million.
2.  The company faces $225 million in long-term debt maturing in 2025, with substantial further maturities in subsequent years.
3.  In 2024, Brown & Brown, Inc. spent $934 million on acquisitions, significantly more than the $695 million spent in 2023.
1. Biogen's total revenue decreased by 1.6% year-over-year to approximately $9.676 billion in 2024.
2. The Inflation Reduction Act is projected to negatively impact Biogen's 2025 revenue by $50 million to $100 million.
3. Biogen's "Fit for Growth" restructuring program, expected to conclude by the end of 2025, will reduce operating expenses by $1 billion and eliminate approximately 1,000 positions.
1. CBRE Group, Inc. reported record Q4 2024 core earnings and free cash flow, with revenue up 16% and net revenue up 18% year-over-year.
2.  For the full year 2024, CBRE achieved Core EPS of $5.10, a 34.1% increase year-over-year, and anticipates 2025 Core EPS to be in the range of $5.80 to $6.10.

3.  CBRE is establishing two new business segments in 2025: Building Operations & Experience and Project Management, resulting from integrating project management capabilities into Turner & Townsend and acquiring full ownership of Industrious.
1. Zoetis Inc. reported Q4 2024 revenue of $2.3 billion (a 5% increase year-over-year) and full-year 2024 revenue of $9.3 billion (an 8% increase year-over-year).
2.  For the full year 2025, Zoetis projects revenue between $9.225 and $9.375 billion, representing 2% to 4% operational growth and 6% to 8% organic operational growth.
3.  The company's 2025 guidance anticipates approximately $30 million in certain significant items and acquisition and divestiture-related costs.
1. American Electric Power (AEP) reported year-end 2024 GAAP earnings of $5.60 per share, a 31% increase compared to $4.26 per share in 2023.
2. Commercial load grew by 10.6% in 2024, driven by increased economic development in AEP’s service territory, and the company anticipates 8-9% annual total retail load growth from 2025-2027.
3. AEP is evaluating $10 billion of potential incremental investment in its service territory and regional transmission grids, in addition to its existing $54 billion, five-year capital plan.
1. Global Payments Inc. reported a significant 63% year-over-year increase in GAAP diluted EPS for Q4 2024, reaching $2.25.
2.  For 2025, the company projects a 10-11% constant currency adjusted EPS growth and a 50 basis point increase in adjusted operating margin (excluding dispositions).
3.  In 2024, Global Payments Inc. achieved $10.11 billion in GAAP revenues, a 4.7% year-over-year increase.
1. Moody's Corporation achieved 20% revenue growth and 26% adjusted diluted EPS growth in FY2024 (ending November 30, 2024).
2. Moody's Analytics experienced a 14% year-over-year decline in transaction revenue in FY2024.
3. Moody's projects high-single-digit adjusted diluted EPS growth and $80 million to $100 million in restructuring charges for FY2025.
1. Iron Mountain reported record full-year 2024 revenue of $6.1 billion, an increase of 12.2% year-over-year.

2.  Iron Mountain's 2025 Adjusted EBITDA growth guidance is projected to be 11% to 13% (12% to 14% excluding foreign exchange), a decrease of 0.5% to 2.5% compared to 2024's 14.5% growth (excluding foreign exchange).
3.  The reduction in Iron Mountain's 2025 earnings expectations is attributed to factors beyond foreign exchange fluctuations.
1. GE HealthCare's diluted EPS increased by $1.31 year-over-year to $4.34 as of December 31, 2024.
2. GE HealthCare projects 2-3% organic revenue growth for 2025, but this projection accounts for market softness in China and newly implemented US tariffs on Chinese products.
3.  The impact of US tariffs on products from China is included in GE HealthCare's 2025 full-year guidance.
1. Deere & Company experienced a 50% year-over-year decrease in net income and a 30% decrease in net sales and revenues in the first quarter of fiscal 2025 (as of February 13, 2025).
2. Despite the significant first-quarter decline, Deere forecasts a stable net income for fiscal year 2025, ranging from $5.0 billion to $5.5 billion.
3. Deere's fiscal year 2025 net income forecast accounts for currency fluctuations and uncertain market conditions as potential risks.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$636,580,419.13 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of February 12, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On February 12, 2025,  20,969,737 Class A shares and 10,345,047 Class B shares were repurchased at a highest price of US$30.01 and US$34.56 respectively.

3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, announced on February 12, 2025, intends to enhance shareholder value and will continue until US$1 billion is reached, subject to market conditions and other factors.

1. On February 11, 2025, ServiceNow, Inc. amended its bylaws to establish the Delaware Court of Chancery as the sole and exclusive forum for certain legal actions,  with federal district courts as the exclusive forum for Securities Act of 1933 claims, unless the company consents otherwise.
2. The bylaws were amended to adjust the notice window for stockholder proposals and director nominations to between 90 and 120 days before the annual meeting.
3.  The bylaws removed provisions related to the classified board structure, reflecting its declassification in 2023.
